subject: Personal Finance
title: Lessons That Were Forgotten
description: A quick win: understand Lessons That Were Forgotten.

hook.text: Glass-Steagall separated commercial and investment banking after 1929. It was repealed in 1999. Then 2008 happened.

buildup.text: The Depression taught regulators to separate risky speculation from ordinary banking.

discovery.text: For decades, the separation worked. Banks were boring and safe. The financial system was stable.

twist.text: By the 1990s, stability bred complacency. Banks lobbied to remove restrictions, arguing they were outdated.

climax.text: Within a decade of repeal, the financial system experienced its worst crisis since the Depression.

quiz.question: What happened after Glass-Steagall was repealed?
options: The 2008 financial crisis occurred within a decade
